Bibliography of Secondary Sources

Endelman, Todd. “Anglo-Jewish Historiography and the Jewish Historiographical Mainstream.” Jewish Culture and History, vol. 12, no. 1–2, 2010, pp. 28–40.

---. “Anglo-Jewish Scientists and the Science of Race.” Jewish Social Studies, vol. 11, no. 1, 2004, pp. 52–92.

---. “Benjamin Disraeli and the Myth of Sephardi Superiority.” Disraeli’s Jewishness, edited by Todd M. Endelman and Tony Kushner, Vallentine Mitchell, 2002.

---. Broadening Jewish History. Liverpool University Press, 2010.

---. “The Chequered Career of ‘Jew’ King: A Study in Anglo-Jewish Social History.” Profiles in Diversity: Jews in a Changing Europe, 1750-1870, edited by Frances Malino and David Sorkin, Wayne State University Press, 1998, pp. 151–81.

---. “Communal Solidarity among the Jewish Elite of Victorian London.” Victorian Studies, vol. 28, no. 3, 1985, pp. 491–526.

---. “The Frankaus of London: A Study in Radical Assimilation, 1837-1967.” Jewish History, vol. 8, no. 1/2, 1994, pp. 117–54.

---. “Gender and Conversion Revisited.” Gender and Jewish History, edited by Marion A. Kaplan and Deborah Dash Moore, Indiana University Press, 2011, pp. 170–86.

---. The Jews of Britain, 1656 to 2000. University of California Press, 2002.

---. The Jews of Georgian England, 1714-1830: Tradition and Change in a Liberal Society. The University of Michigan Press, 1999.

---. The Last Anglo-Jewish Gentleman: The Life and Times of Redcliffe Nathan Salaman. Indiana University Press, 2022.

---. Leaving the Jewish Fold: Conversion and Radical Assimilation in Modern Jewish History. Princeton University Press, 2015.

---. Radical Assimilation in English Jewish History, 1656-1945. Indiana University Press, 1990.

Endelman, Todd M., and Tony Kushner, editors. Disraeli’s Jewishness. Vallentine Mitchell, 2002.

Hoeveler, Diane Long. “Charlotte Dacre’s Zofloya: A Case Study in Miscegenation as Sexual and Racial Nausea.” European Romantic Review, vol. 8, no. 2, 1997, pp. 185–99.

---. “Charlotte Dacre’s Zofloya: The Gothic Demonization of the Jew.” The Jews and British Romanticism: Politics, Religion, Culture, edited by Sheila A. Spector, Palgrave Macmillan, 2005, pp. 165–78.

Hyamson, Albert H. The Sephardim of England: A History of the Spanish and Portuguese Jewish Community, 1492–1951. Methuen, 1951.

Klein, Michele. “The Anglo-Jewish Identity of a Victorian Middle-Class Woman: A Case Study of Mrs. B.M. Merton (1816-1898).” Nashim: A Journal of Jewish Women’s Studies and Gender Issues, vol. 33, 2018, pp. 38–63.

Ruderman, David. Jewish Enlightenment in an English Key: Anglo-Jewry’s Construction of Modern Jewish Thought. Princeton University Press, 2001.

Scrivener, Michael. “British-Jewish Writing of the Romantic Era and the Problem of Modernity: The Example of David Levi.” British Romanticism and the Jews: History, Culture, Literature, edited by Sheila A. Spector, Palgrave Macmillan, 2002, pp. 159–77.

---. “Following the Muse: Inspiration, Prophecy, and Deference in the Poetry of Emma Lyon (1788-1870), Anglo-Jewish Poet.” The Jews and British Romanticism: Politics, Religion, Culture, edited by Sheila A. Spector, Palgrave Macmillan, 2005, pp. 105–26.

---. Jewish Representation in British Literature, 1780–1840: After Shylock. Springer, 2011.

---. “Judaism.” The Cambridge Companion to British Romanticism and Religion, edited by Jeffrey W. Barbeau, Cambridge University Press, 2021, pp. 67–85.

---. “The Philosopher and the Moneylender: The Relationship between William Godwin and John King.” Godwinian Moments: From the Enlightenment to Romanticism, edited by Robert M. Maniquis and Victoria Myers, University of Toronto Press, 2011, pp. 241–60.

---. “Rethinking Margin and Center in Anglo-Jewish Literature.” Romanticism/Judaica: A Convergence of Cultures, edited by Sheila A. Spector, Ashgate, 2011, pp. 157–68.

Spector, Sheila A. Byron and the Jews. Wayne State University Press, 2010.

---. The Evolution of Blake’s Myth. Routledge, 2020.

---. Glorious Incomprehensible: The Development of Blake’s Kabbalistic Language. Bucknell University Press, 2001.

---. “Orientalism in Disraeli’s Alroy.” Interrogating Orientalism: Contextual Approaches and Pedagogical Practices, edited by Diane Long Hoeveler and Jeffrey Cass, The Ohio State University Press, 2006, pp. 121–36.

---. Wonders Divine: The Development of Blake’s Kabbalistic Myth. Bucknell University Press, 2001.

Spector, Sheila A., ed. British Romanticism and the Jews: History, Culture, Literature. Palgrave Macmillan, 2002.

---. The Jews and British Romanticism: Politics, Religion, Culture. Palgrave Macmillan, 2005.

---. Romanticism/Judaica: A Convergence of Cultures. Routledge, 2016.

Weisman, Karen A. Singing in a Foreign Land: Anglo-Jewish Poetry, 1812–1847. University of Pennsylvania Press, 2018.

Williams, Bill. The Making of Manchester Jewry, 1740–1875. Manchester University Press, 1976.

   

Victorian Jewish Writers Project

Welcome to the Victorian Jewish Writers Project, a digital collection focusing on Anglo-Jewish writing during the long nineteenth century. The site is a work-in-progress, so please contact katzir [at] vjwp [dot] org if you need one-on-one assistance.
